meanings.definition: To make something into a text.
meanings.sent1: She decided to textualize her thoughts by writing them down.
meanings.sent2: The author textualized her emotions into a beautiful poem.
meanings.sent3: He tried to textualize his breakfast menu, but it ended up looking like a shopping list.
meanings.sent4: The artist textualized the chaos of the city streets in his abstract painting.
meanings.sent5: In order to remember the information better, she tried to textualize it in her mind.

meanings.definition: To interpret or analyze something as a text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to textualize the poem they had read.
meanings.sent2: Historians often textualize ancient manuscripts to understand the culture of the past.
meanings.sent3: He tried to textualize the traffic patterns, but ended up creating a confusing map.
meanings.sent4: She textualized the music of the birds into a beautiful symphony in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The detective textualized the clues to solve the mystery.
